Hi Cedric..
Thanks for the reply.. Basically I am not into writing the test=
cases. I=C2=A0am developing a tool which takes the JUnit testcases as input=
 to give out Response Time of each method (excluding the setup and teardown=
 times).=C2=A0 Ideally I would know abt the testcase only at runtime.
Thank=
s
Shubha

cbeust@...>

Subject: Re: [junit] which is the best way to obtain test metho=
d execution time


FYI, this is how I would achieve this with TestNG:

- Us=
e @Test(invocationCount =3D 100) to invoke a test method several times
- Us=
e test groups and @BeforeGroups/@AfterGroups to measure the time spent only=
 in a specific group (which can contain more than one test method, of cours=
e)

-- 
C=C3=A9dric



On Wed, Jul 9, 2008 at 6:41 AM, Shubha B S <mailtosh=
ubha@...> wrote:

Hi 
I have a requirement like I have described belo=
w. Please suggest me the best way to achieve this.
My objective in brief:
1=
. Obtain the test method execution time which EXCLUDES setup and teardown t=
ime.
2. Facilitate warm runs for the method. Run the same method more than =
once. B
=C2=A0=C2=A0=C2=A0 (I dont have a problem in getting the iterations=
 from a configuration file)
(Warm tests are facilitated as=C2=A0jvm takes s=
ometime to load the class for the very first run)
I have achieved this by m=
odifying the junit source code. Which I dont think is the best way, as and =
when a new version of junit come in... I should be spending time to identif=
y the instrumentaiton points and modify it. Which is not feasible.
I want t=
o decouple my code from Junit's and still should be able to achive my objec=
tives..
Could anyone suggest a better way to achieve this..?
Thanks
Shubha
